title: linspace error with device='cuda' option
body_html:
Hello,
Using torch.linspace with the device='cuda' option gives an error.

Code example

import torch
x = torch.linspace(-1, 1, 10, device='cuda')

Error message:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: _linspace is not implemented for type torch.cuda.FloatTensor

System Info

  • PyTorch installed with pip
  • PyTorch version: 0.4
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0

body:
Hello,
Using `torch.linspace` with the `device='cuda'` option gives an error.

## Code example
```
import torch
x = torch.linspace(-1, 1, 10, device='cuda')
```
Error message:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: _linspace is not implemented for type torch.cuda.FloatTensor
```

## System Info
- PyTorch installed with pip
- PyTorch version: 0.4
- Python version: 3.6
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0
